mixed-citation.article-title: Revision of the genus Miridiba Reitter, 1902 (Coleoptera, Scarabaeidae, Melolonthinae): genital morphotypes and new taxonomic data

tp:treatment-sec.p: Neodontocnema brancuccii Sabatinelli, 1983: 211 , figs 1–2 ( type loc.: Darjeeling, India ).
Miridiba brancuccii – Smetana & Král 2006: 222 (combination; catalogue). — Coca-Abia 2008: 677 , 684 (in key). — Bezděk 2016: 271 (catalogue).

Sabatinelli (1983) described Neodontocnema brancuccii ignoring the papers of Chang (1964) and Nomura (1977) in which Neodontocnema was synonymized with Miridiba . Later, Smetana & Král (2006) transferred this species to Miridiba , which was confirmed by Bezděk (2016) . According to the original description based on a unique male specimen, features of male genitalia such as parameres with two dorsal and two ventral branches ( Sabatinelli 1983 : figs 1–2) characterize to morphotype I “ Trichophora ”. Hence, this species is included in this genital morphotype.
